channel.title: Posts on Jiaxcuit
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jiaxcuit

item.title: Thoughts on IB Textbooks I Used: Physics HL
item.description: Introduction The following sections are translated by a machine. I’ll check through the content asap. To view the original post in Chinese, just change the “en” in the URL to “zh”! Thanks for your understanding! This is the first post in a series called “My IB Textbook Tips”. The IB subjects covered in this series are Physics, Mathematics AA, Chemistry, History, and Chinese A: Literature for DP, and the corresponding course levels and syllabus versions (when first assessed) are as follows.

item.title: Late-Night Short Note: Mother Tongue
item.description: Last weekend, I was on a team with some students from my school for an online math competition. One of the students on the team (let’s call her Student-A) who was from another grade had a Chinese name, so I assumed that she was Chinese or ethnically Chinese. When we met at school, I was “relieved” to come up and suggest, “Let’s talk in Chinese!” But of course it didn’t go well in the reality.

item.title: Focus, Habit, Feedback: 3 Tips for Exam Prep
item.description: Video to Share As the IB exams are approaching, I started to look for a study method more suitable for short term preparation. Just at the same time, Coach_K updated a video on Bilibili about this exact topic. I watched it and thought he indeed had a point, and the video was a great reminder for me, so I’m sharing it here1: CK - How Should You Prepare for Exams? The Powerful Method of a Student Who Scored Nearly Full Marks in SAT 【CK】如何备考？高考近满分学霸的高能方法).

item.title: Assumptions for an Ideal Transformer
item.description: Transformers are closely related to induction in the study of electricity and magnetism. Here, I share an article1: Weekly Three Questions - Grade 12: (170) What is “ideal” for an ideal transformer? (【每周三题】高三【170】理想变压器都“理想”了什么？), by Wu Aixiong (吴爱兄). This article has largely deepened my understanding of transformers. This article is from Physics Learning Research (物理学习研究), a WeChat Official Account. It posts many other similar articles on physics that investigate into individual topics, including example problems, explanations, and exercises to consolidate knowledge.

item.title: Chinese A Lit: P1 Skills & Exemplars
item.description: Thank you for clicking on this blog post! If you’re doing Chinese A Lit, then I assume you understand Chinese quite well. (And I hope you do😂) So here’s the link to the same post in Chinese (Simplified): 中文文学 P1 写作方法和范文. Any thoughts and comments are welcomed!

item.title: Late-Night Short Note: University Application
item.description: I just helped one of my classmates practice her presentation and watched her present her work. It’s an entrance test for a Dutch university and the real thing is coming tomorrow. And it’s not simply her presenting to the teachers—she’ll present to other applicants, listen to them, talk to them, and the teachers are going to ask her questions. It’s going to take her a whole morning. That Dutch university has so many difficult entrance requirements.

item.title: Chinese A Lit: Key Changes for P1 in the 2021 New Syllabus
item.description: Thank you for clicking on this blog post! If you’re doing Chinese A Lit, then I assume you understand Chinese quite well. (And I hope you do😂) So here’s the link to the same post in Chinese (Simplified): 中文文学 2021 新大纲 P1 变化要点. Any thoughts and comments are welcomed!
